content.question: Students are asked to memorize a list of 100 words. The students are given periodic quizzes to see how many words they have memorized. The function <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gives the number of words memorized at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The rate of change of the number of words memorized is proportional to the number of words left to be memorized. Which of the following differential equations could be used to model this situation, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a positive constant?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of L, with respect to t, equals, k L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of L, with respect to t, equals, 100 minus k L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of L, with respect to t, equals, k times, open parenthesis, 100 minus L, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of L, with respect to t, equals, k L, minus 100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>L</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>100</mn></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of L, with respect to t, equals, k times, open parenthesis, 100 minus L, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>100</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
